DataElement.preferredName: First Pathologic Diagnosis Biospecimen Acquisition Other Method Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to describe a method used to secure tissue for an original pathologic diagnosis that is different from other identified methods.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: First Pathologic Diagnosis Biospecimen Acquisition Other Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.__Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The process by which something is acquired or obtained._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned. (NCI)_A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The process by which something is acquired or obtained.:Not otherwise specified.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
The process by which something is acquired or obtained.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The process by which something is acquired or obtained._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned. (NCI)_Text; the words of something written.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The process by which something is acquired or obtained.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.:Not otherwise specified.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: The process by which something is acquired or obtained.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
